required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate Overall Survival in Japanese Patients With HR+/HER2- Advanced Breast Cancer Treated With Palbociclib Plus Letrozole
clinical_study.official_title: Retrospective, Multicenter, Observational Study to Evaluate Overall Survival in Japanese Patients With HR+/HER2- Advanced Breast Cancer Treated With Palbociclib Plus Letrozole

brief_summary.textblock: This is a retrospective, multicenter, observational study in Japan. The primary objective is to evaluate overall survival (OS) in Japanese patients with HR+/HER2- advanced breast cancer who have been treated with palbociclib plus letrozole. This observational study was planned as follow-up study of Japanese phase 2 study of palbociclib (NCT01684215, phase 2 portion of A5481010 study).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Date of first treatment dose until death or end of study collection on 31 Dec 2022, whichever is later.
primary_outcome.description: Overall survival was the duration from the start of study treatment to death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Type of subsequent therapy after palbociclib plus letrozole
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of first treatment dose until death or end of study collection on 31 Dec 2022

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of subsequent therapy after palbociclib plus letrozole
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Date of first treatment dose until death or end of study collection on 31 Dec 2022

study_pop.textblock: Patients who participated, treated with palbociclib plus letrozole, and under follow-up for survival in J-Ph2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Participated, treated with palbociclib plus letrozole in J-Ph2, and was under follow-up for survival at the study completion of J-Ph2.
2. For patients who are still alive and have routine visits to the study site, evidence of a personally signed and dated informed consent document indicating that the patient has been informed of all pertinent aspects of the study. For patients who are still alive and had been transferred to another hospital, evidence that the patient has been informed of all pertinent aspects of the study and oral or written informed consent is obtained. For patients who had already passed away, the conduct of this study will be disclosed, and the patients' legally acceptable representatives will be guaranteed an opportunity to refuse data collection for the patients in accordance with the Ethical Guidelines for Medical and Health Research Involving Human Subjects
Exclusion Criteria:
1. There are no exclusion criteria for this study.

patient_data.ipd_description: Pfizer will provide access to individual de-identified participant data and related study documents (e.g. protocol, Statistical Analysis Plan (SAP), Clinical Study Report (CSR)) upon request from qualified researchers, and subject to certain criteria, conditions, and exceptions. Further details on Pfizer's data sharing criteria and process for requesting access can be found at: https://www.pfizer.com/science/clinical_trials/trial_data_and_results/data_requests.
